Title: Object: Vue d'un temple de Thèbes à Loùqssor
Description: Plate 24: a group of figures standing before the temple with colonnade, two boats (feluccas) on the river Nile at left, hills of Thebes beyond; after Denon; illustration to Denon's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte' (1802); published state. Etching with engraving
Curator's comments: Date from print study 1836,0109.67. There is another etching by Louis Pierre Baltard after the same drawing as plate 49 to the same publication. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Bibliographic references: Chu 1988 / Dominique Vivant Denon. French master of the nineteenth century (167) (cf.)
IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (undescribed) (after)
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
Acquisition name: Donated by: Nan Ino Cooper, Baroness Lucas of Crudwell and Lady Dingwall (L.1696)
In Memory of: Auberon Thomas Herbert, 9th Baron Lucas of Crudwell and 5th Lord Dingwall
